title: Triage an Incoming Safety Case
description: A drug safety associate must perform the initial triage of a new adverse event case to determine its priority and processing requirements.

tasks.description: Review a newly created case for completeness and validity.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent confirms the case has the four minimum elements for a valid report.

tasks.description: Assess the case for seriousness (e.g., results in death, hospitalization, disability).
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent identifies the event as 'serious' because the patient was hospitalized.

tasks.description: Determine if the case qualifies for expedited reporting to health authorities (e.g., within 7 or 15 days).
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent determines the case is a serious, unexpected event and must be reported within 15 days.

tasks.description: Assign the case to the appropriate workflow for data entry and medical assessment.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent routes the case to the high-priority work queue.
